The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical Senior Financial Analyst, Accounting to join our Finance team. Reporting to the Manager, Accounting, this role will support the month-end close and financial reporting processes while also providing deep financial analysis to support decision-making. This role bridges traditional accounting with forward-looking analysis, ensuring the integrity of financial data and delivering insights on key areas such as business line performance, credit losses, and operational efficiency. The Senior Financial Analyst will work closely with both the Accounting and FP&A teams, as well as cross-functional partners in Product, Growth, and Operations. This is an exciting opportunity for a detail-oriented professional who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment and brings a strong financial acumen and a passion for the FinTech space to contribute significantly to our strategic decision-making and continued success.

What you'll be doing:

Accounting & Reporting

  • Support month-end, quarter-end, and year-end close activities, including journal entries, reconciliations, and variance analysis.

  • Assist with preparation of financial statements under ASPE, ensuring accuracy and compliance.

  • Maintain and reconcile loan accounting sub-ledgers (loan originations, interest accruals, charge-offs, recoveries).

  • Contribute to audit support, working with external auditors and regulators.

Financial Analysis

  • Analyze loan portfolio performance, including credit losses, delinquency trends, and net interest margin.

  • Support the calculation and monitoring of expected credit losses.

  • Provide insights on revenue, expense, and profitability drivers to management.

  • Partner with FP&A to deliver variance analysis, scenario modeling, and forward-looking insights.

Process & Systems

  • Assist in implementing automation and process improvements in accounting workflows.

  • Support system integrations between ERP, and reporting tools.

  • Help document and maintain accounting policies and procedures, especially as new products or lending features are introduced.

  • Assist with establishing internal controls and process narratives around the Company’s financial reporting and accounting functions. This includes advising on the design of information technology general controls (“ITGCs”) and information technology application controls (“ITACs”) applicable to the Company’s financial statements.

Tax

  • Support the Company’s tax compliance function, including assisting with the preparation of tax working papers for corporate income tax and sales tax filings.

  • Communicate directly with external tax consultants, as well as the Canadian Revenue Agency (“CRA”), on tax matters related to the Company.

Collaboration

  • Work closely with cross-functional teams (Product, Growth, Operations) to ensure new initiatives are accurately reflected in accounting and reporting.

  • Serve as a bridge between Accounting and FP&A, ensuring consistency of data and assumptions.

  • Provide ad hoc analysis and reporting for senior management.

Who we are looking for:

  • Designation: CPA designation (or in final stages) preferred.

  • Education: A university degree in Business, Finance or Accounting.

  • Experience: 3-5 years of work experience in an analytical role, with preference given towards prior experience in Big 4.

  • Technical Skills: Strong knowledge of ASPE / IFRS, particularly IFRS 9 and ASPE 3856 (Financial Instruments).

  • Financial Modeling: Advanced Excel (e.g., pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, sumifs) and financial modeling skills; experience with BI/reporting tools an asset.

  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable insights

  • Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex financial information clearly and concisely to non-finance stakeholders

  • Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail and a high level of accuracy in all financial work

  • Proactiveness: Self-starter with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

  • FinTech Interest: A genuine interest in the FinTech industry and an understanding of its unique financial drivers and challenges

Bonus points if you have:

  • Experience with SQL or other data querying languages

  • Familiarity with the financial services industry

  • Experience in a company that has gone through a significant growth phase

Working at Neo:

The people who thrive at Neo are resourceful, growth-oriented, and driven to win. We hold ourselves to high standards because we’re on a mission that matters: to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. As individuals and as a team, we constantly challenge ourselves and each other to do our best work for our customers. Our commitment to customer success drives everything we do, from building intuitive products to providing exceptional support at every step of their journey. If this resonates with you, keep reading.

We trust, respect, and support each other. This means honest conversations, constructive input, and continuous support. You’ll be surrounded by people who push you to be your best. We primarily collaborate in person across our Calgary, Winnipeg, and Toronto offices. As we evolve rapidly, we’re looking for change-makers who thrive on challenge—people who would rather blaze a trail through uncertainty than follow a well-paved path.

All team members have a stake in Neo’s success and earn meaningful equity through stock options. This ownership mindset is at the heart of everything we do — when Neo grows, we all grow. If you’ve heard that Neo employees work hard, it’s true. We hold ourselves accountable for delivering on our commitments to our customers, partners, and each other. Working at Neo means taking ownership of your work and driving results, knowing that your contributions directly impact the company’s success.

  • Top-ranked mobile apps and credit cards

  • Team of 700+ people

  • 1M+ customers

  • 10K+ retail partners

The Role

Neo is looking for an experienced product marketer with depth of experience in leading, planning and executing go-to-market strategies across all marketing channels. You’ll play a pivotal role in translating product strategy into powerful product marketing narratives that will deliver meaning and value for customers, while optimizing for low-cost acquisition for the business. This is a role that cuts across the marketing organization and provides leadership and direction for channel owners and their teams.

What you'll be doing:

  • Own the integrated marketing strategy; aligning investment to channels based on performance objectives you help define

  • Define and deliver product-channel fit; be accountable for how Neo’s products are presented across channels by working with channel owners to define target audiences, provide copy, visual asset, and compliance direction

  • Be responsible for organic web and social channels; maintaining current and best-in-class representation of our products, manage updates to design and architecture, craft web copy, and coordinate organic social post creation

  • Be the expert on the competition and global market as it relates to product positioning, channel strategy, and marketing messaging to further optimize Neo’s product marketing and competitive edge

  • Own and maintain core product marketing guidelines and channel plan that provide foundational understanding of our products and how we are going to market

  • Be responsible for any legal or compliance reviews and approvals that involve product marketing; being a bridge between channel owners, content creators, and the legal team

  • Consult with product strategy and leadership to ensure alignment on product scope and marketing approach

  • Lead the development of resonant campaign level product messaging through the translation of core product value propositions and how they relate to customer needs

Who we are looking for:

  • 7+ years of related product marketing experience within a high growth environment

  • A degree in marketing, business, or a related field

  • Proven experience in creatively positioning and marketing products in a highly competitive and regulated environment on the national and/or global stage

  • Results-oriented and data-driven with demonstrated experience defining integrated go-to-market roadmaps across all marketing channels

  • Strong communicator and facilitator with the ability to work cross-functionally and bring different perspectives together

  • Experience in directing and shaping marketing concepts and content -- from headlines and tone of voice, to visual direction and design

  • Adaptable to new and fast-changing environments with a proven ability to succeed through ambiguity and stretch your potential

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join us to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians


At Neo, we’re on a mission to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. Life at a rapidly expanding tech startup isn’t for everyone.   • LinkedIn’s Top Startup in Canada for 2022 and 2023

  • Top-ranked mobile apps and credit cards

  • Team of 700+ people

  • 1M+ customers

  • 10K+ retail partners

The Role

We’re hiring a Head of Product to lead Lending at Neo, a portfolio that includes credit cards, loans, installments, advances, and the systems that power them. You’ll drive both the consumer experience and the risk, underwriting, and servicing infrastructure that supports responsible, scalable credit across millions of Canadians. This is a senior leadership role: you'll own the product strategy, the roadmap, the outcomes and the development of the product team delivering it.

This role is about setting a bold vision, building what doesn't yet exist, and scaling what does. You’ll lead a division of PMs and work alongside senior engineering, design, data, and operations leaders to solve complex problems with clarity and urgency. You’ll be accountable for both the product and the people: hiring, mentoring, coaching, and shaping the next generation of product leaders at Neo.

We're looking for someone who’s scaled product teams, shipped high-impact products, and thrives in a hands-on, fast-changing environment. If you’re excited to build the strategy and roll up your sleeves when needed, you’ll be in the right place.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Own the full-stack lending product portfolio, from customer-facing experiences (e.g. credit cards, loans, installments) to core systems for underwriting, credit risk, and repayment.

  • Define and evolve the credit infrastructure that enables fast, compliant, and accurate lending decisions, including decision engines, data pipelines, and risk policy tooling.

  • Lead initiatives to improve servicing, collections, and lifecycle management — ensuring a seamless and transparent experience for borrowers.

  • Navigate complex regulatory and reporting requirements (e.g., credit bureau integrations, consumer disclosures) with scalable product solutions.

  • Lead, grow, and mentor a team of high-performing product managers. You’ll develop talent, shape team culture, and create the conditions for great work.

  • Act as the cross-functional glue for your division, collaborating with senior leaders across engineering, design, data, ops, marketing, and executive leadership.

  • Translate customer needs, business goals, and technical constraints into clear product strategies, decisions, and trade-offs.
    Own the results. Your team’s work will directly move core business metrics and customer impact and you’ll hold yourself accountable for outcomes, not just output.

  • Elevate product quality and execution across your teams through strong systems, clear feedback, and day-to-day coaching.

  • Champion a culture of speed, ownership, and learning. We move fast — but we don’t cut corners.

  • Represent product in strategic conversations with exec leadership, external partners, and investors.

Who We're Looking For:

  • 8–12+ years of product management experience, including 4+ years in a senior leadership role (e.g., leading other PMs or a product org).

  • You’ve built and led product teams in high-growth environments, ideally with both 0→1 and scale experience.

  • You’re a strategic thinker who can move between long-term planning and in-the-weeds execution without missing a beat.

  • You bring strong product judgment, clear systems thinking, and a bias toward action.

  • You’ve led cross-functional workstreams that include technical complexity, ambiguous problems, and diverse stakeholder input.

  • You care deeply about talent: hiring the right people, growing them fast, and building a healthy, high-performing team.

  • You lead with influence, not just authority. You know how to rally people around a vision, and communicate clearly up, down, and sideways.

  • You’re comfortable making bold bets and adapting quickly when the facts change.

  • Domain experience in lending, banking or Fintech is a strong asset, but as important is your ability to ramp fast and think like an owner.

Working at Neo:

The people who thrive at Neo are resourceful, growth-oriented, and driven to win. We hold ourselves to high standards because we’re on a mission that matters: to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. As individuals and as a team, we constantly challenge ourselves and each other to do our best work for our customers. Our commitment to customer success drives everything we do, from building intuitive products to providing exceptional support at every step of their journey. If this resonates with you, keep reading.

We trust, respect, and support each other. This means honest conversations, constructive input, and continuous support. You’ll be surrounded by people who push you to be your best. We primarily collaborate in person across our Calgary, Winnipeg, and Toronto offices. As we evolve rapidly, we’re looking for change-makers who thrive on challenge—people who would rather blaze a trail through uncertainty than follow a well-paved path.

All team members have a stake in Neo’s success and earn meaningful equity through stock options. This ownership mindset is at the heart of everything we do — when Neo grows, we all grow. If you’ve heard that Neo employees work hard, it’s true. We hold ourselves accountable for delivering on our commitments to our customers, partners, and each other. Working at Neo means taking ownership of your work and driving results, knowing that your contributions directly impact the company’s success.

Apply with us:

We believe in equal opportunity and are committed to creating an inclusive climate where everyone can thrive. Customers trust us with their finances, so successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and a credit check.

jobs.descriptionHtml:

At Neo, we’re on a mission to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. Life at a rapidly expanding tech startup isn’t for everyone. It’s complex, fast-paced, high-pressure, but also incredibly fulfilling. Since its founding in 2019, Neo has gained incredible traction and is one of the fastest-growing fintech companies in Canada.

  • #1 Fastest Growing Company in Canada for 2024 by Globe & Mail

  • Deloitte’s Fast 50 in Canada Winner for 2023 and 2024

  • LinkedIn’s Top Startup in Canada for 2022 and 2023

  • Top-ranked mobile apps and credit cards

  • Team of 700+ people

  • 1M+ customers

  • 10K+ retail partners

The Role

We’re hiring a Head of Product to lead Lending at Neo, a portfolio that includes credit cards, loans, installments, advances, and the systems that power them. You’ll drive both the consumer experience and the risk, underwriting, and servicing infrastructure that supports responsible, scalable credit across millions of Canadians. This is a senior leadership role: you'll own the product strategy, the roadmap, the outcomes and the development of the product team delivering it.

This role is about setting a bold vision, building what doesn't yet exist, and scaling what does. You’ll lead a division of PMs and work alongside senior engineering, design, data, and operations leaders to solve complex problems with clarity and urgency. You’ll be accountable for both the product and the people: hiring, mentoring, coaching, and shaping the next generation of product leaders at Neo.

We're looking for someone who’s scaled product teams, shipped high-impact products, and thrives in a hands-on, fast-changing environment. If you’re excited to build the strategy and roll up your sleeves when needed, you’ll be in the right place.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Own the full-stack lending product portfolio, from customer-facing experiences (e.g. credit cards, loans, installments) to core systems for underwriting, credit risk, and repayment.

  • Define and evolve the credit infrastructure that enables fast, compliant, and accurate lending decisions, including decision engines, data pipelines, and risk policy tooling.

  • Lead initiatives to improve servicing, collections, and lifecycle management — ensuring a seamless and transparent experience for borrowers.

  • Navigate complex regulatory and reporting requirements (e.g., credit bureau integrations, consumer disclosures) with scalable product solutions.

  • Lead, grow, and mentor a team of high-performing product managers. You’ll develop talent, shape team culture, and create the conditions for great work.

  • Act as the cross-functional glue for your division, collaborating with senior leaders across engineering, design, data, ops, marketing, and executive leadership.

  • Translate customer needs, business goals, and technical constraints into clear product strategies, decisions, and trade-offs.
    Own the results. Your team’s work will directly move core business metrics and customer impact and you’ll hold yourself accountable for outcomes, not just output.

  • Elevate product quality and execution across your teams through strong systems, clear feedback, and day-to-day coaching.

  • Champion a culture of speed, ownership, and learning. We move fast — but we don’t cut corners.

  • Represent product in strategic conversations with exec leadership, external partners, and investors.


Who We're Looking For:

  • 8–12+ years of product management experience, including 4+ years in a senior leadership role (e.g., leading other PMs or a product org).

  • You’ve built and led product teams in high-growth environments, ideally with both 0→1 and scale experience.

  • You’re a strategic thinker who can move between long-term planning and in-the-weeds execution without missing a beat.

  • You bring strong product judgment, clear systems thinking, and a bias toward action.

  • You’ve led cross-functional workstreams that include technical complexity, ambiguous problems, and diverse stakeholder input.

  • You care deeply about talent: hiring the right people, growing them fast, and building a healthy, high-performing team.

  • You lead with influence, not just authority. You know how to rally people around a vision, and communicate clearly up, down, and sideways.

  • You’re comfortable making bold bets and adapting quickly when the facts change.

  • Domain experience in lending, banking or Fintech is a strong asset, but as important is your ability to ramp fast and think like an owner.

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager, Payments
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join us to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians


At Neo, we’re on a mission to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. Life at a rapidly expanding tech startup isn’t for everyone. It’s complex, fast-paced, high-pressure, but also incredibly fulfilling. Since its founding in 2019, Neo has gained incredible traction and is one of the fastest-growing fintech companies in Canada.

  • #1 Fastest Growing Company in Canada for 2024 by Globe & Mail

  • Deloitte’s Fast 50 in Canada Winner for 2023 and 2024

  • LinkedIn’s Top Startup in Canada for 2022 and 2023

  • Top-ranked mobile apps and credit cards

  • Team of 700+ people

  • 1M+ customers

  • 10K+ retail partners

The Role

We’re hiring a Senior / Lead Product Manager to work on the foundational systems that power how money moves: from payment rails and card processing to credit risk infrastructure. You’ll work deep in the stack to ensure our platform is scalable, secure, and flexible enough to support the next generation of financial products. This role is about more than managing a roadmap: it’s about figuring out what we should build, why it matters, and how to make it real. You’ll work closely with a tight-knit team of designers and engineers to solve real problems for millions of Canadians. That might mean shaping long-term strategy, getting scrappy with prototypes, running experiments, digging through data, or jumping on calls with customers. You’ll be expected to think big, sweat the details, and help your team move fast in the right direction.Neo is growing quickly, and that means this role won’t stay static. You'll likely be building some products from scratch, scaling others, and adapting into new domains as priorities shift. If you're excited by the idea of owning a big slice of a product, figuring things out as you go, and building for impact then you’ll feel at home here.

What you'll be doing:

  • Lead the design and evolution of core money movement infrastructure, including payment processing, disbursements, settlements, and ledger systems.

  • Build internal platforms that support credit risk decisioning, authorization logic, and compliance needs, enabling faster development and safer financial operations.

  • Set a clear product vision for your area — and make sure your team deeply understands the “why” behind what you're building.

  • Work closely with designers, engineers, marketers and anyone else needed to move from insight to implementation. You’ll go from whiteboard to shipped product (and probably back again).

  • Talk to users regularly. You’ll gather insights firsthand and use them to shape decisions, challenge assumptions, and uncover opportunities.

  • Write narratives, not just tickets. You’ll bring structure to ambiguity through clear strategy docs, roadmaps, and product briefs that help everyone make better decisions.

  • Define success with real metrics and drive measurable results.

  • Prioritize like it’s a superpower. You’ll have to make smart trade-offs, manage edge cases, and keep the team focused on what truly matters.

  • Contribute to improving our product culture. You’ll mentor peers, share learnings, and help raise the bar across the team.

Who we are looking for:

  • Experienced Product Manager (5+ years) with a track record of building and scaling complex systems — ideally in fintech, payments, or infrastructure-heavy products.

  • Proven experience with payment rails, money movement, or financial services APIs, and a strong grasp of the operational and regulatory complexity behind them.

  • Comfortable working hands-on with engineers, architects, designers, and operations teams — titles don’t matter, outcomes do.

  • Systems thinker who can connect long-term strategy with detailed execution and edge-case handling.

  • Data-driven and outcome-obsessed — you measure success by the impact you create, not just the features you ship.

  • Skilled communicator who can simplify complex topics and deliver compelling product narratives and roadmaps to both technical and executive audiences.

  • Thrive in ambiguous, fast-moving environments where priorities evolve and problems aren’t clearly defined.

  • Lead with humility and curiosity — high standards, low ego, and a focus on lifting others up.

  • Prior experience in fintech or payments infrastructure strongly preferred; fast learners with deep ownership mindset welcome.

Working at Neo:

The people who thrive at Neo are resourceful, growth-oriented, and driven to win. We hold ourselves to high standards because we’re on a mission that matters: to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. As individuals and as a team, we constantly challenge ourselves and each other to do our best work for our customers. Our commitment to customer success drives everything we do, from building intuitive products to providing exceptional support at every step of their journey. If this resonates with you, keep reading.

We trust, respect, and support each other. This means honest conversations, constructive input, and continuous support. You’ll be surrounded by people who push you to be your best. We primarily collaborate in person across our Calgary, Winnipeg, and Toronto offices. As we evolve rapidly, we’re looking for change-makers who thrive on challenge—people who would rather blaze a trail through uncertainty than follow a well-paved path.

All team members have a stake in Neo’s success and earn meaningful equity through stock options. This ownership mindset is at the heart of everything we do — when Neo grows, we all grow. If you’ve heard that Neo employees work hard, it’s true. We hold ourselves accountable for delivering on our commitments to our customers, partners, and each other. Working at Neo means taking ownership of your work and driving results, knowing that your contributions directly impact the company’s success.

Apply with us:

We believe in equal opportunity and are committed to creating an inclusive climate where everyone can thrive. Customers trust us with their finances, so successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and a credit check.

By continuing with your application, you agree to the Candidate Privacy Notice which guides how we process your personal information for the purpose of your application.

  • Executive Brand Strategy: Provide executive oversight of all brand management, focusing on the strategic direction of the brand. As a key leader, you will act as the primary brand ambassador in the market.

  • Data-Driven Decisions: Champion a data-driven culture across the marketing organization.   • Public Relations and Communications: You will serve as a key spokesperson and cultivate relationships with top-tier media and industry stakeholders to shape the brand's narrative and ensure positive coverage.

  • A proven track record of excelling in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, balancing multiple priorities with ease.

  • Experience: 15+ years of progressive experience in a strategic marketing leadership role, with a minimum of 10 years in a senior leadership position. Experience within the FinTech or a similar high-growth tech industry is highly desirable.

  • Education: Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, or a related field; an MBA or advanced degree is a plus.

  • Adaptability: You demonstrate flexibility, adaptability, and resilience in a dynamic work environment where priorities can shift rapidly.

This is a hands-on, strategic role that requires a leader who is passionate about combining innovation with marketing excellence.

What you'll be doing:

 - Build the Marketing Function: Design and implement a data-driven, high-impact marketing strategy from the ground up that aligns with Neo’s business drivers and organizational priorities.

 - Strategic Leadership: Provide executive oversight and direction for all multi-channel marketing campaigns. You will set the vision for how to reach target audiences, drive lead generation, and enhance customer acquisition and retention. You will also be responsible for building and mentoring a high-performing leadership team within marketing, fostering a culture of creativity and excellence.

 - Executive Brand Strategy: Provide executive oversight of all brand management, focusing on the strategic direction of the brand. You will ensure the brand's positioning in the market is clear and that all messaging is consistent across the organization. As a key leader, you will act as the primary brand ambassador in the market.

 - Data-Driven Decisions: Champion a data-driven culture across the marketing organization. You will be responsible for leveraging customer and market insights at a strategic level to inform business decisions and marketing investments, ensuring alignment with company-wide financial goals and delivering measurable business impact.

 - Cross-Functional Collaboration: Serve as the primary marketing liaison on the executive team. You will build deep partnerships with product, sales, and other senior leaders to ensure marketing strategy is fully integrated with overall business objectives and go-to-market plans.

 - Public Relations and Communications: You will serve as a key spokesperson and cultivate relationships with top-tier media and industry stakeholders to shape the brand's narrative and ensure positive coverage.

 - A proven track record of excelling in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, balancing multiple priorities with ease.

 - Education: Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, or a related field; an MBA or advanced degree is a plus.

 - Strategic & Analytical Skills: You have strong diagnostic skills and a data-driven mindset, with the ability to translate market insights into actionable strategies and a tangible business impact.

 - Leadership & Influence: You are an exceptional leader with the ability to inspire, motivate, and manage a team to achieve ambitious goals. You have a proven ability to build trust and influence leaders and teams across the organization.

 - Adaptability: You demonstrate flexibility, adaptability, and resilience in a dynamic work environment where priorities can shift rapidly.

 - A deep understanding of the Canadian market and its unique financial services landscape.

 - Expertise in key marketing areas such as digital marketing, performance marketing, content, SEO/SEM, and social media.

 - A results-oriented professional who takes ownership, prioritizes effectively, and delivers measurable business impact.

 - A passion for building and scaling a company that is combining innovation, growth, and excellence.

The Role

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Mortgage Fulfillment, you will be crucial in streamlining the mortgage approval process for Canadians. Your core responsibilities include the accurate and efficient review of mortgage documentation to ensure strict adherence to Neo's guidelines and proactive communication with brokers to secure all outstanding items. This role is key to maintaining the efficiency of our underwriting team and serves as a vital safeguard for fraud mitigation.

What you'll be doing:

  • Follow up with mortgage brokers for outstanding documents, ensuring each document is reviewed, complete and accurate

  • Conduct verbal verification of employment, ensuring that all proper due diligence is exercised

  • Manage the Documents Management System and ensure that documents are handled within the established SLA

  • Satisfy conditions to bring files to broker complete

  • Liaise with and manage communication from third party service providers

  • Keep informed of Neo mortgage products/services, interest rates, lending guidelines and other pertinent information

  • Complete ad hoc requests on an as needed basis

Who we are looking for:

  • Minimum 1-2 years of mortgage fulfillment experience in the Canadian mortgage industry

  • A self-starter, with a positive attitude who can lead by example

  • Experienced with Google Suite platform

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

  • Proven ability to foster and maintain strong business relationships

  • Organized and process-oriented, with strong problem-solving skills

  • Ability to work under high pressure and multi-task in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment with a strong attention to detail.

  • Able to work independently and as part of a team

  • Project Manager: You take ownership of anything that is assigned to you

  • Analytical: You can break down complex information for our clients

  • Resourceful: You may not have all the answers, but you know how to get them

  • Proactive: You are never idle and love being busy

  • Ability to comprehend and assess documentation relating to mortgage down payment and borrower income confirmation

  • Lead the design, maintenance, and implementation of core credit adjudication strategies, policies, and processes for customer acquisition.

  • Define all underwriting criteria for lending products, including knock-out rules, minimum credit scores, Debt-to-Income (DTI) ratio thresholds, and income requirements.

  • Develop initial credit line assignment strategies and oversee logic within automated decisioning systems (in-house or vendor platforms) to ensure accurate, real-time approve/decline decisions.

  1. Advanced Analytics & Portfolio Monitoring

  • Utilize advanced data analytics and machine learning to analyze risk profiles, identify emerging trends, and quantify exposure across the credit lifecycle.

  • Conduct vintage analysis (e.g., comparing Q1 2025 to Q1 2024 performance) by monitoring key delinquency rates, including First Payment Default (FPD), 30+ & 60+ DPD, and Charge Off rates.

  • 1M+ customers

The Role:

Neo Financial is looking for an Intermediate iOS Developer to join our team in Calgary.

In this role, you will collaborate with other talented developers, deliver high-quality code and contribute to exciting and impactful projects. You‘ll work on building new features for a highly rated iOS app while following best practices like automated testing and code reviews. You’ll work with cutting edge tools and patterns. Our technology stack is built using Swift, SwiftUI, and GraphQL.

What you'll be doing:

  • Write exemplary code in Swift to create the best-in-class iOS app that interfaces with our GraphQL API.

  • Create features and reusable components with SwiftUI and UIKit.

  • Working closely with Android and Web engineers to develop a consistent user experience.

  • Learn the patterns and practices needed to build robust and maintainable code.

  • Perform meaningful code reviews with in-depth yet constructive criticism; give and take feedback.

  • Actively work on high-quality unit and UI testing.

  • Ensure solutions meet customer and business needs - not just minimum defined requirements

  • Leverage AI-powered development tools like GitHub Copilot for code generation and to assist in code reviews.

Who we are looking for:

  • Fluent in Swift, SwiftUI and UIKit.

  • 2+ years of full-time experience as an iOS developer.

  • Proficient with Xcode, Git and GitHub.

  • Interest in expanding your skills to encompass new languages and technologies.

  • Familiarity with releasing an app to App Store using CI/CD practices.

  • You possess a passion for iOS design principles and user experience.

  • Familiarity with AI-powered development tools (e.g., GitHub Copilot) is an asset.

We are looking for motivated Sales Representatives who are excited to represent Neo and be part of this movement. You will be directly responsible for acquiring customers by signing them up for the Neo Credit card, the Neo Money account and other Neo products.

As the face of Neo, Sales Representatives earn a guaranteed hourly rate, as well as an uncapped commission for each product they help customers open, and bonuses for exceeding targets - paid semi-monthly. You’ll be alerted the moment a customer opens a Neo Account using your link, so you can track your performance in real-time!

  • Instant commission: Get paid at the time of sale directly into your Neo App.

  • Career advancement: We’re not your typical Sales Team. Full-time opportunities are available with benefits for those who are meeting or exceeding our targets

What we’re looking for

  • Enthusiasm to share our products with Canadians in your own community

  • Ability to travel across your city to various locations

  • Money motivated individuals

  • An interest in technology or financial products

  • Previous experience in direct sales, door-to-door sales, telemarketing, retail, or marketing is helpful

  • We are looking for individuals who can work full-time or part-time hours. If you are sales driven and have a track record of high performance, we can work together to create a schedule that works for you.

Earnings:

  • We pay $20.00 an hour, plus commission that is paid instantly at the point of sale, and additional performance bonuses.

  • The average on-target wage of our Sales Representatives is $36/hour.

Job Type:

Full-time/Part-time hours, contract role.

Working at Neo:

The people who thrive at Neo are resourceful, growth-oriented, and driven to win. We hold ourselves to high standards because we’re on a mission that matters: to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. As individuals and as a team, we constantly challenge ourselves and each other to do our best work for our customers. Our commitment to customer success drives everything we do, from building intuitive products to providing exceptional support at every step of their journey. If this resonates with you, keep reading.

We trust, respect, and support each other. This means honest conversations, constructive input, and continuous support. You’ll be surrounded by people who push you to be your best. We primarily collaborate in person across our Calgary, Winnipeg, and Toronto offices. As we evolve rapidly, we’re looking for change-makers who thrive on challenge—people who would rather blaze a trail through uncertainty than follow a well-paved path.

All team members have a stake in Neo’s success and earn meaningful equity through stock options. This ownership mindset is at the heart of everything we do — when Neo grows, we all grow. If you’ve heard that Neo employees work hard, it’s true. We hold ourselves accountable for delivering on our commitments to our customers, partners, and each other. Working at Neo means taking ownership of your work and driving results, knowing that your contributions directly impact the company’s success.

Apply with us:

We believe in equal opportunity and are committed to creating an inclusive climate where everyone can thrive. Customers trust us with their finances, so successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and a credit check.

jobs.descriptionHtml:

  • Top-ranked mobile apps and credit cards

  • Team of 700+ people

  • 1M+ customers

  • 10K+ retail partners

The Role:

Neo Financial is looking for a Senior React Native Developer to join our mobile team in Calgary.

As a Senior Developer, you’ll lead development on our cross-platform mobile applications that power the Neo customer experience. You’ll tackle complex product challenges, mentor other developers, and help shape the future of our mobile architecture. Our mobile stack is built on React Native, TypeScript, GraphQL, and native integrations where performance or access to device capabilities requires it.

You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-impact features, optimize performance, and ensure a seamless and delightful mobile experience. We’re also accelerating our development velocity using tools like GitHub Copilot, Cursor, and internal AI agents—and you'll be part of shaping how we build with AI.

What you'll be doing:

  • Take technical ownership of core areas in our React Native codebase across iOS and Android

  • Design and build scalable, performant, and elegant mobile features in TypeScript and React Native

  • Lead technical direction for major initiatives, ensuring architectural consistency and performance across platforms

  • Write high-quality, testable code and enforce rigorous standards through code reviews

  • Help evolve and maintain our design system and component libraries for mobile

  • Work closely with backend engineers, designers, and product managers to bring features to life

  • Guide adoption of mobile-specific testing practices including unit, integration, and end-to-end testing (e.g. Jest, Detox)

  • Analyze and optimize performance using profiling tools and real-world telemetry

  • Mentor intermediate and junior developers, sharing knowledge and encouraging continuous improvement

  • Push forward mobile CI/CD best practices with tools like EAS, Fastlane, or Bitrise

Who we are looking for:

  • Expert in React Native and TypeScript, with a deep understanding of cross-platform development nuances

  • Proven experience building and scaling complex mobile apps for both iOS and Android, ideally in a high-growth environment

  • Strong grasp of mobile performance optimization, debugging tools, and native module integration when needed (Swift, Objective-C, Kotlin, or Java)

  • Solid experience working with GraphQL APIs and managing client-side state

  • Bonus for experience with Expo (including EAS build and deploy), or managing hybrid codebases

  • Strong understanding of design systems, mobile accessibility, and scalable architecture patterns (e.g. monorepos, modularization)

  • Familiarity with observability tools like Sentry, Datadog, or Firebase Performance Monitoring

  • Experience mentoring other developers and working across teams on large-scale product development

  • Passion for AI-assisted development and interest in how it can accelerate engineering work

  • 6+ years of professional software development experience, with significant time spent on mobile

**Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada and willing to relocate to Calgary — relocation packages and reimbursements are available.

The people who thrive at Neo are resourceful, growth-oriented, and driven to win. We hold ourselves to high standards because we’re on a mission that matters: to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. As individuals and as a team, we constantly challenge ourselves and each other to do our best work for our customers. Our commitment to customer success drives everything we do, from building intuitive products to providing exceptional support at every step of their journey. If this resonates with you, keep reading.

We trust, respect, and support each other. This means honest conversations, constructive input, and continuous support. You’ll be surrounded by people who push you to be your best. We primarily collaborate in person across our Calgary, Winnipeg, and Toronto offices. As we evolve rapidly, we’re looking for change-makers who thrive on challenge—people who would rather blaze a trail through uncertainty than follow a well-paved path.

All team members have a stake in Neo’s success and earn meaningful equity through stock options. This ownership mindset is at the heart of everything we do — when Neo grows, we all grow. If you’ve heard that Neo employees work hard, it’s true. We hold ourselves accountable for delivering on our commitments to our customers, partners, and each other. Working at Neo means taking ownership of your work and driving results, knowing that your contributions directly impact the company’s success.

Apply with us:

We believe in equal opportunity and are committed to creating an inclusive climate where everyone can thrive. Customers trust us with their finances, so successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and a credit check.

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer, Operations Excellence
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join us to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians


At Neo, we’re on a mission to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. Life at a rapidly expanding tech startup isn’t for everyone. It’s complex, fast-paced, high-pressure, but also incredibly fulfilling. Since its founding in 2019, Neo has gained incredible traction and is one of the fastest-growing fintech companies in Canada.

  • #1 Fastest Growing Company in Canada for 2024 by Globe & Mail

  • Deloitte’s Fast 50 in Canada Winner for 2023 and 2024

  • LinkedIn’s Top Startup in Canada for 2022 and 2023

  • Top-ranked mobile apps and credit cards

  • Team of 700+ people

  • 1M+ customers

  • 10K+ retail partners

The Role

We’re hiring a Senior Product Designer to shape the experience of our Operations Excellence domain, the core to our support systems, financial wellness tools, and customer chat products.

You’ll design the experiences that help customers get the answers, guidance, and confidence they need, whether they’re resolving an issue, understanding their finances, or planning their next step. This work is critical to building trust, driving satisfaction, and creating meaningful long-term relationships with our customers.

Neo is growing quickly, so this role will evolve as we do. You’ll help build new products, scale existing ones, and raise the bar for operational excellence across our platform. If you want to own big outcomes, move fast, and redefine what “support” means in financial services, you’ll thrive here.

What you'll be doing:

  • Design end-to-end product experiences for our support, customer wellness, and customer chat products across web and mobile, balancing usability, performance, and delight.

  • Collaborate with PMs, engineers, and business leaders from problem framing through execution to ensure we’re solving the right problems in the best way.

  • Lead discovery efforts, mapping journeys, defining flows, prototyping concepts, and validating ideas through research and iteration.

  • Build systems, not just screens, designing for scalability, accessibility, and the real-world complexities of operational tools and customer interactions.

  • Shape strategy for Operations Excellence, influencing roadmap decisions with a deep understanding of customer needs and business priorities.

  • Work with research, analytics, and content design to uncover opportunities and create experiences that improve satisfaction and reduce support volume.

  • Contribute to Neo’s design system, ensuring consistent, high-quality experiences across all customer touchpoints.

  • Advocate for the customer, using design to make support feel simple, human, and trustworthy.

  • Mentor and support other designers, sharing feedback, tools, and best practices.

Who we are looking for:

  • 5+ years of product design experience, shipping real-world products across platforms.

  • Strong craft across interaction design, visual design, and information architecture.

  • Experience working cross-functionally with PMs, engineers, operations, and support teams.

  • A systems thinker who can connect micro-interactions to broader service and customer journeys.

  • Comfortable in ambiguity, you bring structure, clarity, and momentum to messy problem spaces.

  • Obsessed with measurable outcomes: you care as much about resolution rates, CSAT, and financial confidence as you do about pixels.

  • Strong communicator who can present, explain, and defend design decisions with clarity and humility.

  • Experience in support tools, chat platforms, or financial services is a plus, but not required, you can learn fast and think like an owner.

The people who thrive at Neo are resourceful, growth-oriented, and driven to win. We hold ourselves to high standards because we’re on a mission that matters: to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. As individuals and as a team, we constantly challenge ourselves and each other to do our best work for our customers. Our commitment to customer success drives everything we do, from building intuitive products to providing exceptional support at every step of their journey. We trust, respect, and support each other. This means honest conversations, constructive input, and continuous support. You’ll be surrounded by people who push you to be your best. We primarily collaborate in person across our Calgary, Winnipeg, and Toronto offices. As we evolve rapidly, we’re looking for change-makers who thrive on challenge—people who would rather blaze a trail through uncertainty than follow a well-paved path.

If you’ve heard that Neo employees work hard, it’s true. We hold ourselves accountable for delivering on our commitments to our customers, partners, and each other. jobs.title: Senior Mortgage Underwriter
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join us to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians


At Neo, we’re on a mission to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. Life at a rapidly expanding tech startup isn’t for everyone. It’s complex, fast-paced, high-pressure, but also incredibly fulfilling. Since its founding in 2019, Neo has gained incredible traction and is one of the fastest-growing fintech companies in Canada.

  • #1 Fastest Growing Company in Canada for 2024 by Globe & Mail

  • Deloitte’s Fast 50 in Canada Winner for 2023 and 2024

  • LinkedIn’s Top Startup in Canada for 2022 and 2023

  • Top-ranked mobile apps and credit cards

  • Team of 700+ people

  • 1M+ customers

  • 10K+ retail partners

The Role

As a senior mortgage Underwriter you’ll be responsible for underwriting deals from across the country. You’ll work closely with our Mortgage Sales team and third party brokers to ensure we’re finding the most effective solutions for our customers, and through that, you’ll be an integral part of enabling Neo to deliver a full range of financing products and services partnered with an exceptional customer experience. If you love a fast paced environment where growth and opportunities are constant, you’ll fit right in with this team!

What you'll be doing:

  • Underwrite complex and high-value mortgage loan applications, including those with unique borrower profiles or property types.

  • Serve as a mentor and resource for junior underwriters, Mortgage Fulfillment Officer (MFO) and Mortgage Coordinators providing guidance on underwriting policies and best practices.

  • You successfully deliver mortgages from the application stage through to funding with the support of your MFO

  • You execute skilled and clear communication with Sales team, mortgage brokers, and internal /external partners to ensure their understanding of the mortgage process, expectations and documentation required

  • You liaise with the Sales team, MFOs, Coordinators, and third party brokers on status updates for active mortgage files

  • You utilize a hands-on approach and problem-solving skills to make prudent decisions on complex mortgage files. If needed, you may be required to review mortgage documentation

  • You work with management for support on complex files where standard lending solutions have been exhausted

  • You develop subject matter expertise in the functionality and features of products, services, tools, technology, and Salesforce CRM capabilities

  • You remain current on the latest industry trends to secure a competitive advantage

Who we are looking for:

  • You have 4+ years of underwriting experience in the Canadian mortgage industry

  • You have a passion for growth and excellence, consistently striving to deliver the highest quality results in a startup environment

  • You bring epic focus and energy, with a strong dedication to client service

  • You have superior communication skills, both verbal and written

  • You're highly organized with exceptional time management capabilities

Additional Role details:

  • This role will be in-office where possible, but flexible to consider remote candidates who are not located near an office.

The Role

At Neo, we’re rebuilding the financial system from the ground up—one product, experience, and transaction at a time. As a Product Manager on the Spend team, you’ll own the strategy and growth of our credit card and payments platform that’s redefining what spending can feel like.

You’ll turn big ideas into real products that millions of Canadians use every day—driving meaningful impact for customers and the business.

What you'll be doing:

  • Own the vision. Shape the roadmap for Neo’s credit card and payments experiences—connecting how Canadians spend across credit, rewards, and banking.

  • Launch and grow. Build products that lead the market in value, performance, and experience—and never stop pushing the bar higher.

  • Lead cross-functional teams. Partner with engineering, design, and data to bring ideas to life quickly, with impact at scale.

  • Think strategically, act fast. Break down complex problems into simple, iterative releases that deliver customer and business value—fast.

  • Understand the ecosystem. Dive deep into credit models, fraud protection, collections, and vendor integrations to make our systems smarter and stronger.

  • Stay close to customers. Talk to users, dig into the data, and build products that solve real problems and earn real loyalty.

Who we are looking for:

  • 5+ years of product experience shipping impactful products that customers love.

  • A builder’s mindset—you believe in shipping fast, learning, and iterating, not debating endlessly.

  • Strong ownership and bias for action—you move ideas from concept to launch with speed and accountability.

  • Curiosity and first-principles thinking—you question assumptions and simplify the complex.

  • Sharp analytical and business acumen—you’re comfortable with data, modeling, and defining tradeoffs that drive value.

  • Technical fluency—you can navigate technical conversations, understand architectural decisions, and evaluate platform tradeoffs.

Ownership: We all have a stake in Neo’s success — so we go out of our way to do what needs to get done. We hold ourselves accountable to deliver on our commitments — to our customers, to our partners, and to our team. When we fall short, we find a way to do better in the future.

Successful candidates will be skilled in providing exceptional customer service, addressing customer inquiries and concerns in a timely manner, and implementing strategies to enhance the overall customer experience while simultaneously driving sales.

  • You will handle weekly scheduling for all sales associates

  • You will act as a support to sales associates in their daily activities

  • Strong network of sales representatives who bring experience interacting with clientele of all ages

jobs.descriptionHtml:

At Neo, we’re on a mission to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. Life at a rapidly expanding tech startup isn’t for everyone. It’s complex, fast-paced, high-pressure, but also incredibly fulfilling. Since its founding in 2019, Neo has gained incredible traction and is one of the fastest-growing fintech companies in Canada.

The Role

At Neo, we are reimagining how Canadians experience financial products, making them smarter, simpler, and more rewarding. Our team is growing quickly, and we are looking for a Marketing Manager, Lifecycle to join us in building meaningful customer experiences through powerful communications and campaigns.

This is a unique opportunity to blend strategic lifecycle marketing with creative copywriting and messaging excellence. You will own the end-to-end execution of lifecycle initiatives while crafting compelling stories that connect with customers across every stage of their journey.

What you'll be doing:

Messaging and Communications

  • Write and refine clear, compelling copy for lifecycle campaigns from acquisition through engagement and retention

  • Adapt messaging across channels including email, in-app, push, web, and social, ensuring every touchpoint feels cohesive and impactful

  • Translate complex product and financial concepts into simple, audience-friendly narratives that inspire action

  • Shape Neo’s lifecycle communications playbook, helping evolve our brand voice in ways that resonate with diverse audiences

Lifecycle Strategy and Campaign Management

As a District Sales Manager at Neo Financial, you will be a pivotal leader responsible for the profitability and success of a designated district, encompassing up to six mall locations. You will directly manage and develop up to six Store Managers, ensuring their effectiveness in driving sales, achieving key performance indicators, and adhering to Neo’s operational standards. Your focus will be on maximizing efficiency, optimizing Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC), and fostering a high-performance sales culture within your district. This role requires a proactive individual with strong leadership, training, and analytical skills, coupled with the ability to operate independently and travel frequently within the district.

What you'll be doing:

  • Drive District Profitability: Take ownership of the financial performance of your district and each individual mall, ensuring profitability through effective management of Store Managers and their teams.

  • Optimize Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC): Drive efficiencies and savings in CAC by implementing rigorous performance management practices and conducting regular cost assessments across all locations within your district.

  • Recruit, Onboard, and Develop Store Managers: Lead the full lifecycle of Store Managers within your district, including hiring, comprehensive onboarding, and ongoing professional development.

  • Lead Sales Training Initiatives: Spearhead training efforts within your district, including facilitating large-scale sales representative onboarding sessions during mall launches and delivering ongoing company and product training to both Store Managers and sales representatives.

  • Ensure Operational Excellence: Champion adherence to Neo’s operational frameworks across all mall locations, ensuring Store Managers are proficient in utilizing tools such as Google Suite, Slack, and company data dashboards.

  • Data-Driven Performance Management: Leverage a strong understanding of data to analyze performance trends, interpret key metrics, and implement strategies to drive continuous improvement in sales and efficiency.

  • Independent District Management: Proactively manage your own schedule to travel between mall locations within your district on a daily basis, prioritizing visits based on operational needs and training demands.

  • Support Store Manager Success: Act as a key resource and support system for your Store Managers, providing guidance, coaching, and mentorship to ensure their individual and store-level success.

Who we are looking for:

  • Sales Experience: Ideally 7+ years of direct-to-consumer sales experience (door-to-door, mobile sales, credit card or financial product sales preferred), with a significant portion of this experience in managing field sales teams.

  • Management & Leadership Experience: 7+ years of proven management and leadership experience, with a track record of successfully managing teams of 10 or more individuals, including field sales teams.

  • Training & Coaching Skills: A high level of training and coaching proficiency, with over 7+ years of experience developing and delivering effective sales training programs.

  • Network of Sales Representatives: Possesses a strong, existing network of high-performing sales representatives suitable for representing Neo Financial.

  • Performance & Business Acuity:

  • Proven ability to drive profitability and manage performance across multiple locations.

  • Strong understanding of and experience in managing Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC).

  • Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.

  • A fundamental and strong understanding of data analysis and the ability to interpret data dashboards to drive decision-making.

  • Self-motivated and highly organized with the ability to manage their own schedule and travel independently within the district.

Our Risk & Compliance team navigates through a fast-paced environment and we know how to switch gears to adapt to any scenario. We strive to make things better, simpler and stronger. Make your mark by addressing the dynamic and ever changing landscape of risk and compliance, alongside some of Canada’s most successful leaders and tech minds

What you'll be doing:

  • Controls Design & Implementation: Lead the design and implementation of internal controls
    across various business units to support a strong internal control environment.

  • External Audit Liaison: Act as the primary liaison with external auditors. Lead the planning and
    execution of various external audits, including SOC 1, SOC 2, and PCI DSS.

  • Risk Assessment: Evaluate business processes and procedures to identify compliance risks and
    develop improvement plans. Complete ad-hoc assessments of control failures and lead the way
    in building processes and controls to strengthen the control environment.

  • Policy Management: Regularly review and update policies and processes to reflect the latest
    jurisdictional regulations and emerging risk and compliance best practices. Investigate and
    respond to audit and risk issues and partner inquiries, including preparing required
    documentation and making recommendations to senior management.

  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work with product and engineering teams to embed automated
    controls into products and internal tools to meet compliance requirements. Work closely with
    senior management to develop and maintain a cultural focus on compliance throughout the
    organization.

  • Reporting & Communication: Prepare comprehensive reports summarizing control findings, risk
    exposures, and recommendations for management. Present these findings to relevant
    stakeholders and senior leadership.

  • Team Leadership: Bring leadership qualities and experience to support and grow a team,
    providing guidance and support for their professional development.

  • Performance Management: Set goals, delegate tasks, and conduct regular performance reviews
    to ensure high-quality work and professional growth.

  • Strategic Planning: Develop and execute the long-term strategy for the audit and controls
    function, aligning it with overall business objectives and risk management goals

Who we are looking for:

  • A proactive self-starter who wants to identify problems and lead the way in solving them.

  • Minimum 5+ years of experience in internal controls, audit, risk management, or other similar
    roles, preferably with knowledge within financial services.

  • Proven experience leading and managing the execution of external audits and liaising with
    external auditors. Experience with SOC 1 and SOC 2 audits is an asset.

  • A strong background in financial controls is considered an asset.

  • Experience in a people management or supervisory role including the ability to motivate and
    inspire a team.

  • An ability to build relationships as well as establish trust and credibility with your colleagues
    through excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.

  • Experience working effectively in a team environment where flexibility, collaboration, and
    adaptability are important.

  • Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Administration, Communications, or a closely related
    field.

  • CPA, CISA or CIA designation are required.

  • Possess strong organizational and prioritizing skills.

  • Have advanced Microsoft Office or G Suite skills.

  • Working knowledge of IT and financial controls frameworks (e.g., SOC1/2, COSO, COBIT, NIST,
    PCI DSS)

  • PCIP/ISA qualification is considered an asset.

  • Knowledge and/or experience with relevant legislation and regulation is an asset (i.e. FINTRAC,
    FCAC, PIPEDA, OSFI).

At Neo, we’re on a mission to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. Life at a rapidly expanding tech startup isn’t for everyone. It’s complex, fast-paced, high-pressure, but also incredibly fulfilling. Since its founding in 2019, Neo has gained incredible traction and is one of the fastest-growing fintech companies in Canada.

  • #1 Fastest Growing Company in Canada for 2024 by Globe & Mail

  • Deloitte’s Fast 50 in Canada Winner for 2023 and 2024

  • LinkedIn’s Top Startup in Canada for 2022 and 2023

  • Top-ranked mobile apps and credit cards

  • Team of 700+ people

  • 1M+ customers

  • 10K+ retail partners

The Role


This Senior Associate role is a high-impact position on Neo's Finance team, requiring you to wear multiple hats and drive financial outcomes. You'll be responsible for supporting key initiatives that drive growth and financial performance within a fast-paced FinTech.

Your focus will be two-fold: Corporate Development (spanning M&A opportunities, corporate partnerships/Joint Ventures, and strategic initiatives) and Commercial Finance (supporting the capital markets function at both corporate and product levels).

This role will analyze market opportunities, assess the financial viability of potential acquisitions and partnerships, and develop dynamic financial models to support critical business decisions.

What you'll be doing:

I. Capital Markets & Funding Platform

  • Supporting Capital Raising: Lead complex financing modelling, analysis, and execution efforts to support the continued build of a robust funding platform.

  • Relationship Management: Assist in the creation of new and the fostering of existing bank and institutional partner relationships to secure funding both at the corporate level and for specific product lines (e.g., credit card receivables, mortgage, new loan products).

  • Treasury Support: Collaborate with the Treasury function on liquidity planning, strategic initiatives, risk management, and deal closings.

II. Corporate Development & Strategic Initiatives

  • Co-Brand Partnerships: Drive the financial analysis and presentation materials in RFP processes to build and expand Neo's co-brand partner network, developing clear financial rationales and projections. Lead the financial modelling, analysis, and business casing for strategic initiatives with existing co-brand and corporate partnerships.

  • Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A): Support the end-to-end M&A process, including target identification/screening, due diligence coordination, valuation analysis, transaction structuring, and integration planning.

Who we are looking for:

  • 3-5 years of progressive corporate finance and/or deal-making experience.

  • Demonstrated expertise in building complex financial models from scratch.

  • Strong understanding of financial statements and accounting principles.

  • Investment Banking, Private Equity, Consulting, or Big 4 Transaction Advisory experience is a plus.

  • Progress towards or completion of a CFA or relevant professional designation is an asset.

  • Direct experience within the FinTech, financial services, or technology sectors.

  • Familiarity or experience with the Canadian mortgage space (e.g., securitization, NHA MBS) is a plus.

  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate complex financial concepts to a non-technical audience.

Working at Neo:

The people who thrive at Neo are resourceful, growth-oriented, and driven to win. We hold ourselves to high standards because we’re on a mission that matters: to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. As individuals and as a team, we constantly challenge ourselves and each other to do our best work for our customers. Our commitment to customer success drives everything we do, from building intuitive products to providing exceptional support at every step of their journey. If this resonates with you, keep reading.

We trust, respect, and support each other. This means honest conversations, constructive input, and continuous support. You’ll be surrounded by people who push you to be your best. We primarily collaborate in person across our Calgary, Winnipeg, and Toronto offices. As we evolve rapidly, we’re looking for change-makers who thrive on challenge—people who would rather blaze a trail through uncertainty than follow a well-paved path.

All team members have a stake in Neo’s success and earn meaningful equity through stock options. This ownership mindset is at the heart of everything we do — when Neo grows, we all grow. If you’ve heard that Neo employees work hard, it’s true. We hold ourselves accountable for delivering on our commitments to our customers, partners, and each other. Working at Neo means taking ownership of your work and driving results, knowing that your contributions directly impact the company’s success.

Apply with us:

We believe in equal opportunity and are committed to creating an inclusive climate where everyone can thrive. Customers trust us with their finances, so successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and a credit check.

By continuing with your application, you agree to the Candidate Privacy Notice which guides how we process your personal information for the purpose of your application.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join us to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians


At Neo, we’re on a mission to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. Life at a rapidly expanding tech startup isn’t for everyone. It’s complex, fast-paced, high-pressure, but also incredibly fulfilling. Since its founding in 2019, Neo has gained incredible traction and is one of the fastest-growing fintech companies in Canada.

  • #1 Fastest Growing Company in Canada for 2024 by Globe & Mail

  • Deloitte’s Fast 50 in Canada Winner for 2023 and 2024

  • LinkedIn’s Top Startup in Canada for 2022 and 2023

  • Top-ranked mobile apps and credit cards

  • Team of 700+ people

  • 1M+ customers

  • 10K+ retail partners

High Performance at Neo

We recruit, hire, and build our company culture around these attributes:

Teamwork: We trust, respect, encourage, and show up for each other — through good times and hard. We’re on this mission not just for ourselves, but also for the people we work with — and ultimately, for our customers.

Ownership: We all have a stake in Neo’s success — so we go out of our way to do what needs to get done. We hold ourselves accountable to deliver on our commitments — to our customers, to our partners, and to our team. When we fall short, we find a way to do better in the future.

Professional Integrity: We’re asking millions of Canadians to trust us with their hard-earned money — so we hold ourselves (and each other) to the highest standards of integrity.

The Role

The Store Manager oversees all aspects of store operations, including sales performance, staffing, inventory management and customer service. The Store Manager will recruit, train, and motivate a high-performing team, provide ongoing coaching and feedback, and foster a positive work environment that promotes teamwork and collaboration. Successful candidates will be skilled in providing exceptional customer service, addressing customer inquiries and concerns in a timely manner, and implementing strategies to enhance the overall customer experience while simultaneously driving sales.

What you’ll be doing:

  • You will be responsible for recruiting strong sales focused individuals to join your team through active job boards and by leveraging your existing network.

  • You will train, coach and develop sales associates to be high performers, driven to exceed sales targets and performance expectations.

  • You will be the Chief Culture Officer of your store, leading by example on what is expected of your team.

  • You will handle weekly scheduling for all sales associates

  • You will act as a support to sales associates in their daily activities

Who we are looking for:

  • Fluent in both English and French

  • 5-10 years of experience working in retail sales with a focus on creating strong relationships and lasting rapport with current and future clients

  • A proven track record in cross selling clients on multiple products and services

  • Experience leading and developing a high performing sales team while managing turnover

  • Strong network of sales representatives who bring experience interacting with clientele of all ages

Working at Neo:

The people who thrive at Neo are resourceful, growth-oriented, and driven to win. We hold ourselves to high standards because we’re on a mission that matters: to build a more rewarding financial future for all Canadians. As individuals and as a team, we constantly challenge ourselves and each other to do our best work for our customers. Our commitment to customer success drives everything we do, from building intuitive products to providing exceptional support at every step of their journey. If this resonates with you, keep reading.

We trust, respect, and support each other. This means honest conversations, constructive input, and continuous support. You’ll be surrounded by people who push you to be your best. We primarily collaborate in person across our Calgary, Winnipeg, and Toronto offices. As we evolve rapidly, we’re looking for change-makers who thrive on challenge—people who would rather blaze a trail through uncertainty than follow a well-paved path.

All team members have a stake in Neo’s success and earn meaningful equity through stock options. This ownership mindset is at the heart of everything we do — when Neo grows, we all grow. If you’ve heard that Neo employees work hard, it’s true. We hold ourselves accountable for delivering on our commitments to our customers, partners, and each other. Working at Neo means taking ownership of your work and driving results, knowing that your contributions directly impact the company’s success.

Apply with us:

We believe in equal opportunity and are committed to creating an inclusive climate where everyone can thrive. Customers trust us with their finances, so successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and a credit check.

By continuing with your application, you agree to the Candidate Privacy Notice which guides how we process your personal information for the purpose of your application.

It’s complex, fast-paced, high-pressure, but also incredibly fulfilling. Since its founding in 2019, Neo has gained incredible traction and is one of the fastest-growing fintech companies in Canada.

  • Deloitte’s Fast 50 in Canada Winner for 2023 and 2024

  • LinkedIn’s Top Startup in Canada for 2022 and 2023

  • Top-ranked mobile apps and credit cards

  • Team of 700+ people

  • 1M+ customers

  • 10K+ retail partners

The Role

We're looking for experienced Mortgage Underwriters who will be responsible for reviewing documentation and underwriting deals from across the country. You’ll work closely with our Mortgage Sales team and third party brokers to ensure we’re finding the most effective solutions for our customers, and through that, you’ll be an integral part of enabling Neo to deliver a full range of financing products and services partnered with an exceptional customer experience. If you love a fast paced environment where growth and opportunities are constant, you’ll fit right in with this team!

What you'll be doing:

  • Underwrite complex and high-value mortgage loan applications, including those with unique borrower profiles or property types.

  • You successfully deliver mortgages from the application stage through to funding with the support of your MFO

  • You execute skilled and clear communication with Sales team, mortgage brokers, and internal /external partners to ensure their understanding of the mortgage process, expectations and documentation required

  • You liaise with the Sales team, MFOs, Coordinators, and third party brokers on status updates for active mortgage files

  • You utilize a hands-on approach and problem-solving skills to make prudent decisions on complex mortgage files If needed, you may be required to review mortgage documentation

  • You develop subject matter expertise in the functionality and features of products, services, tools, technology, and Salesforce CRM capabilities

  • You remain current on the latest industry trends to secure a competitive advantage

Who we are looking for:

  • You have 2+ years of underwriting experience in the Canadian mortgage industry

  • You have a passion for growth and excellence, consistently striving to deliver the highest quality results in a startup environment

  • You bring epic focus and energy, with a strong dedication to client service

  • You have superior communication skills, both verbal and written

  • You're highly organized with exceptional time management capabilities

Additional Role details:

  • This role will be in-office where possible, but flexible to consider remote candidates who are not located near an office.

  • Working hours, at times, may be outside a traditional Monday to Friday, 9am-5pm MST schedule. This will be determined on an as needed basis.

  • Top-ranked mobile apps and credit cards

  • Team of 700+ people

  • 1M+ customers

  • 10K+ retail partners

The Role

As Senior Growth Acquisition Manager, you will influence the strategy, execution, and optimization of our paid media campaigns across multiple channels. You’ll play a critical role in acquiring high-quality users/customers, scaling spend efficiently, and improving our ROI through continuous testing, analysis, and optimization. This is an opportunity to have a direct impact on Neo’s growth trajectory while working in a highly visible, cross-functional role. The position can either be located in Calgary or Toronto. If located in Toronto quarterly travel to the Calgary office would be required.

  • Influence the end-to-end strategy and execution of paid campaigns across platforms like Google Ads, Meta (Facebook/Instagram), TikTok, YouTube, LinkedIn, and emerging channels.

  • Driving conversion rate optimization across the customer funnel through detailed analysis, segmentation, and iterative experimentation strategies.

  • Building and executing A/B testing and segmentation frameworks to uncover and act on opportunities for improving funnel performance.

  • Analyzing data to identify bottlenecks and tailoring customer experiences for different segments to maximize conversion rates.

  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to address barriers in the customer journey and align strategies around key customer segments.

  • Reporting on KPIs such as leads, conversion rates, and segmented performance, and providing leadership with actionable recommendations to drive growth,

  • Proven expertise in running and optimizing paid media across Google Ads, Meta, TikTok, and other key platforms.

  • A strong analytical mindset with the ability to iterate and segment customer journeys, translating data into actionable strategies for improvement.

  • Demonstrated expertise in optimizing user experiences across the funnel, leveraging data-driven insights to improve conversion rates while balancing long-term growth and short-term results.

  • Autonomous and detail-oriented with a track record of owning complex funnels end-to-end and driving measurable results.

  • Innovative thinker who thrives in fast-paced, ambiguous environments, consistently delivering impactful outcomes through experimentation and iteration.
